member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DocumentStartingScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when the current document starts generating.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DocumentEndedScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when the current document has finished generating.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.PageConfigureScript
member.summary:
Gets or sets the script that is executed when a new page is added to the document. This script executes after the page has been added to the collection but before it is resolved (i.e. when the content of the page has not been laid out yet).
This script should be used only to change the page layout. Do not use this script to change the page content, as it may cause errors.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.ErrorScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when an error occurs in a script attached to the document.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

Describes a link to an external document, file or URL. The link is performed using the ShellExecute API.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.FileName
member.summary: Specifies the file or object on which to execute the specified verb.
member.remarks: To specify a Shell namespace object, pass the fully qualified parse name. Note that not all verbs are supported on all objects. For example, not all document types support the "print" verb.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.Command
member.summary: String, referred to in this case as a verb, that specifies the action to be performed.

remarks.para: The set of available verbs depends on the particular file or folder. Generally, the actions available from an object's shortcut menu are available verbs.
For more information about verbs and their availability, see Object Verbs. See Extending Shortcut Menus for further discussion of shortcut menus.
The following verbs are commonly used.

list.item: edit Launches an editor and opens the document for editing. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

item.description: Explores the folder specified by FileName.
Initiates a search starting from the specified directory.
Opens the file specified by the FileName parameter. The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder.
Prints the document file specified by FileName. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

For systems prior to Microsoft? Windows? 2000, the default verb is used if it is valid and available in the registry. If not, the "open" verb is used. For Windows 2000 and later systems, the default verb is used if available. If not, the "open" verb is used. If neither verb is available, the system uses the first verb listed in the registry.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.Parameters
member.summary: If the FileName parameter specifies an executable file, Parameters is a string that specifies the parameters to be passed to the application. The format of this string is determined by the verb that is to be invoked. If FileName specifies a document file, Parameters should be an empty string.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.Directory
member.summary: String that specifies the default directory.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum
member.summary: Defines how the table header is repeated.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.None
member.summary: The header is printed once at the top of the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.Page
member.summary: The header is repeated at the top of each page. If there are multiple columns per page, the header is repeated only at the top of the first column on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.Column
member.summary: The header is repeated only if there are multiple columns per page, at the top of each column except the first on the page. If there is only one column, the header is not printed at all.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.All
member.summary: The header is repeated at the top of all pages. If there are multiple columns per page, the header is repeated at the top of each column.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum
member.summary: Defines how the table footer is repeated.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.None
member.summary: The footer is printed once at the end of the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.Page
member.summary: The footer is repeated at the bottom of each page. If there are multiple columns per page, the footer is repeated only at the bottom of the last column on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.Column
member.summary: The footer is repeated only if there are multiple columns per page, at the bottom of each column except the last on the page. If there is only one column, the footer is not printed at all.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.All
member.summary: The footer is repeated at the bottom of all pages. If there are multiple columns per page, the footer is repeated at the bottom of each column.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.GetActiveDataBinding
member.summary: Gets the instance of C1DataBinding class that is used for this group typically this is a value of DataBinding property, but if DataBinding does not defined for group the parent data binding will be returned (or parent of parent etc).

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroupCollection.DataBindingMode
member.summary:
Gets the data binding mode. For a collection of TableVectorGroup object this property returns:
None no groups are data bound.
Unsupported at least one group is data bound to an unsupported data source.
List at least one group is data bound, and all data bound groups are bound to supported data sources.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum
member.summary: Describes the actions to be performed when the TAB key is pressed in C1PrintPreview control which is connected to the doc engine.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPage
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the page, but does not leave the preview nor goes to another page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDoc
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document (including across pages). Focus does not leave the preview.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPageCycle
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the page. When the last control is reached focus goes to the first control on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDocCycle
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document. When the last control is reached focus goes to the first control in the document.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPageOut
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the page. When the last control is reached focus goes to the next control on the form containing the preview.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDocOut
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document. When the last control is reached focus goes to the next control on the form containing the preview.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum
member.summary: Describes the actions to be performed when the ENTER key is pressed in C1PrintPreview control which is connected to the doc engine.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum.None
member.summary: No action is taken.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum.LikeTab
member.summary: The same action as that of the TAB key is taken.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum.InvokeAcceptButton
member.summary: The Accept button is invoked.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.Utils.TryParseInt(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its 32-bit signed integer equivalent. A return value indicates whether the operation succeeded. This functions uses FloatFormatInfo as format provider.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the 32-bit signed integer value equivalent to the number contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not of the correct format, or represents a number less than MinValue or greater than MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.Utils.TryParseDouble(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its double-precision floating-point number equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. This functions uses FloatFormatInfo as format provider.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains a double-precision floating-point number equivalent to the numeric value or symbol contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not in a format compliant with style, represents a number less than MinValue or greater than MaxValue, or if style is not a valid combination of NumberStyles enumerated constants. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum
member.summary: Defines the splitting behavior of a render object.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.Never
member.summary: The object should not be split between pages (i.e. should always be kept together on a single page).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitIfNeeded
member.summary: The object can be split if it does not fit onto the current page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitIfLarge
member.summary: The object can be split only if it is too large to fit on an empty page. In that case, the object is split immediately. Otherwise, a new page is started and the object is placed on it without splitting.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitNewPage
member.summary: If the object does not fit on the current page (column), a new page (column) is started; if the object does not fit on that page (column), it is split as needed after that.

member.summary: New page should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.Column
member.summary: New column should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.Line
member.summary: New line on inline flow should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.VisibilityEnum.Collapse

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum
member.summary: Defines the stacking rules: block flow or inline flow, LeftToRight or TopToBottom.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.BlockTopToBottom
member.summary: Objects are placed one beneath the other within the container. When the bottom edge of the current page is reached, a new page is added. This is the default.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.BlockLeftToRight
member.summary: Objects are placed one next to another, from left to right. When the right edge of the current page is reached, a new horizontal page is added (a horizontal page logically extends the preceding page to the right; C1PreviewPane respects this location by default, showing such pages in a row).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.InlineLeftToRight
member.summary: Objects are placed inline, one next to another, from left to right. When the right edge of the current page is reached, the sequence wraps to the next line. A new page is added when the bottom of the current page is reached.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange
member.summary: Describes a part of the document (pages or objects) that is to be exported or printed. Note: all page numbers are 1-based sequential numbers.

member.summary: If included in the page indices list, specifies that all pages from preceeding to the next one are to be included in the output.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.NoPage
member.summary: This value indicates an invalid page number.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the output range that includes all pages in the document. Note that enumerating the resulting range must be broken by the client.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the output range that includes all pages in the document.
member.param: The maximum page number (used to prevent infinite enumeration).

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an instance of OutputRange that includes a single interval of pages. FromPage may be greater than ToPage, in that case the range is inverted.
member.param: The number of the first page to include (1-based).
The number of the last page to include (1-based).

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of OutputRange that includes all pages with numbers specified in the list. The list may include Dash values to specify intervals.
member.param: The array of page numbers to include.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of OutputRange that includes pages specified by the string parameter. The string may contain: - page numbers (1-based) separated by spaces or commas; - dashes ('-') to specify intervals (a dash at the end implies infinity).
member.param: The pages to be included.

member.summary: Copies values from another instance of OutputRange.

member.summary: Returns the page number in the range following the specified one, or -1 if the specified number was the last one.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.GetNextPage(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the page number in the range following the specified one, or -1 if the specified number was the last one.
member.param: The current page number.
A cookie used to avoid infinite loops in cases where the same page number appears in several ranges. Set this value to 0 before the first call to this method.
member.returns: The next page number or -1 if there's none.

member.summary: Tests whether the specified page is within the range.

member.returns: True if the page is in the range, false otherwise.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange._normalizePageNumbers
member.summary: Replaces all intervals w/out internals (such as "7-8", "4-3" etc.) with sequences (removes the dashes).

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange._findSequentialPages(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: For a given page number, finds the previous and the next page numbers in the range (not taking the Inverted flag into consideration).
member.param: The current page number.
In/Out: A cookie used to avoid infinite loops in cases where the same page is included in multiple ranges.
Out: the previous page number, or NoPage if there's none.
Out: the next page number, or NoPage if there's none.
member.returns: True if the current page itself is in the range, false otherwise.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange._findLastPage
member.summary: Finds the last page in sequence (not taking the Inverted flag into consideration).
member.returns: The number of the last page.

member.summary: Removes the top dimension from stack.

Dimension of object.
member.returns: Returns true if stack has a dimension.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RefDim
member.summary:
Internal, describes the dimensions of object.
Left, Top, Right, Bottom - Absolute coordinates on page.
RelLeft, RelTop, RelRight, RelBottom - Relative coordinates in parent.
ChildLeft, ChildTop, ChildRight, ChildBottom - Relative coordinates for child objects, ChildLeft and ChildTop are always 0, ChildRight = Width - SpacingLeft - SpacingRight - PaddingLeft - PaddingRight - BordersLeft - BordersRight
Width, Height - sizes of object.
ChildWidth, ChildHeight - sizes for child objects, for example, ChildWidth is Width - (SpacingLeft + BorderLeft + PaddingLeft) - (SpacingRight + BorderRight + PaddingRight).
